intro: Diaphananthe sarcorhynchoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with a short, thick stem and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
